Class oracle.html.Frameset

Class oracle.html.Frameset 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----oracle.html.Item
           |
           +----oracle.html.Frameset
public class Frameset
extends Item
Description:

The Frameset class is encapsulates a Frameset element.

Instructions:

Use this clas together with Frame class to divide your web pages into independent, scrollable regions.

Example: 

// Create a new Frameset object
Frameset frameset = new Frameset();
// divide the web page into 2 columns (25% width the left column, 75% the other)
frameset.setCols("25%,75%");
// set alternative Html to be displayed if browser does not support Frames
frameset.setAltHtml(altHtml);
// Creates the frame objects
Frame frames[] = new Frame[2];
frames[0]=new Frame("/java/demo.toc", "toc");
frames[1]=new Frame("/java/demo.table", "content");
// add the frames to the frameset object
for (int i=0; i< 2; i++)
  frameset.addFrame(frames[i]);

See Also:
Frame

Creates an empty frameset object
Note: You must use setRows or setCols to set either the ROWS or COLS attribute of frameset if you use this constructor.

                  String cols,

Creates a frameset object
Parameters:
rows - ROWS attribute
cols - COLS attribute
altHtml - alternative Html to be displayed if browser does not support frame.
frames - frames to be included in this framset
